citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Persicobacter Nakagawa et al. 1997
Persicobacter (Per.si.co.bac′ter. Gr. n. persikos or persikon peach; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Persicobacter peach rod, because the organism is a peach-coloured rod).
The genus description is as given by Nakagawa et al. (1997) with the following changes.
Cells are Gram-staining-negative, non-spore-forming, slender rods that are motile by gliding.
Colonies are spreading and produce large gelase fields and deep craters in agar plates.
Saproxanthin is present as the major carotenoid pigment.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
Seawater or NaCl is required for growth.
The type species is Persicobacter diffluens.
